ratings.comment: It's clear he knows what he's talking about but is a very boring teacher. Every class consisted of him reading off his lecture slides which he posts. There's no point in attending his class.

All I'm going to say is he just screwed up on his own example problem 3 times before figuring out how to do it properly. Every time anybody asks a clarifying question he just agrees because I'm convinced he doesn't actually understand English. Madison clearly needs a better selection process for professors this is just embarrassing. Good luck.

Pretty much what everyone else said. He doesn't teach well and reads from the "notes" section on his powerpoint, which means we don't see any of this and he often stutters to make sure he understands what he is reading. Makes for a very confusing and unproductive lecture. Take this class with Morrow if you can

If you skip class and read the lecture slides, you will most likely pass.  If you want a class to sleep through, this is the one for you as he does not teach worth crap. He reads the slides but does not explain them. You will do better in this class if you do the work yourself rather than trying to learn in lecture.

It's not very often I feel compelled to leave reviews for Professors, but Mr. Nayar just does not get it. He is extremely disconnected with the class, and his lectures consist of him reading slides posted online verbatim. Not sure why UW puts graduate students in a professor role, and clearly this instance is not working for him or the students.

He just read the content on the slides without detailed explanation and even made mistakes when explaining them. His lectures are organized so badly that we even don't have class sometimes because we are ahead of the schedule.

252 in Spring'17 was his first class as a professor. His words, not mine. And it shows. He knows the subject but doesnt know how to teach and seems entirely clueless about it. Lectures comprise of him reading off the slides without actually explaining anything and blank faces when he gives you problems to solve. You're gonna have to teach yourself.

One of the worst profs I've had here. He reads word for word off of the slides, and does not clarify any points. You must read the text/youtube carefully. I've never seen so many confused looks during a lecture. Take this course with someone else, it is fundamental to the rest of the CE major.

The purpose of coming to lecture is to clarify information in for the current readings. In his lecture, you are left more confused on the chapter's material than before. If you ever have to have him as a professor, be prepared to teach yourself the material.

Even if you figure out words he says, he doesn't explain HOW he does any of the things in class and just tells you to do them. "Here's an example, please work on it." (confused students' faces stare at board) "Alright you seem confused, please work on another example." Might as well skip and watch YouTube video on the content instead. Stay away.

He seems to have a misunderstanding of what teaching means... he doesn't do it... at all. He goes through many examples but doesn't describe them very well nor does he teach you how to do the content before doing the examples
Hold his clip on mic instead of clipping it on. He just quizes you on the information before teaching it (half the class time)
